value.title: Are you following best practices with Azure Synapse Analytics?
value.excerpt: How do you know if you are following best practices for Azure Synapse Analytics? One way is to check out this report that Patrick walks through. It's a great way to get an understanding where your database is at!  Azure Synapse Analyzer Report to monitor and improve Azure Synapse SQL Dedicated Pool performance

value.title: Bring Power BI to your every day Microsoft Teams usage
value.excerpt: Have you added the Power BI app to Microsoft Teams? Bring Power BI closer to your day to day and have your reports ready when you need them! Adam shows you how.  Announcement Blog: https://powerbi.microsoft.com/en-us/blog/announcing-new-power-bi-experiences-in-microsoft-teams/  üì¢ Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership

value.title: Create a Power BI Template file in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: In this 2 minute Tuesday, Patrick shows you how to export a Power BI Template file and then use that to create a new Power BI report within Power BI Desktop.  ******** LET'S CONNECT! ********  -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://twitter.com/awsaxton -- http://twitter.com/patrickdba -- http://www.facebook.com/guyinacube

value.title: Create Power BI reports in Power BI Report Server
value.excerpt: Create Power BI reports in Power BI Report Server  In this video, I walk through the steps to create your Power BI Report in order to publish it to Power BI Report Server. This involves downloading and installing Power BI Desktop optimized for Power BI Report Server and connecting to Analysis Services

value.title: Do you want DYNAMIC legends in Power BI??? Of course you do...
value.excerpt: We wish Power BI had dynamic legends based on selections! Well, Patrick took the challenge and here is a way you can do just that! Shout out to Parker Stevens, at BI Elite, for getting us started on this.  BI Elite video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8e8a3o1w51M BI Elite Twitter: https://twitter.com/PowerBIElite

value.title: Dynamic labels in Power BI using DAX
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick uses a little DAX, and the SelectedValue function, to get you some dynamic labels in your Power BI reports.  For more information about SelectedValue, check out Marco Russo's blog on the function - https://www.sqlbi.com/articles/using-the-selectedvalue-function-in-dax/  LET'S CONNECT!

value.title: Expand lists in Power BI (also a look at M Syntax)
value.excerpt: I show how you can take a table that lists "Record" and expand that within Power BI. This also works with Power Query. I have a look at the M Syntax and show a cleaner approach.  SUBSCRIBE! https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCFp1vaKzpfvoGai0vE5VJ0w?sub_confirmation=1  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube

value.title: Using Images from a Database in Power BI

R Script Showcase - http://community.powerbi.com/t5/R-Script-Showcase/bd-p/RVisuals

value.title: How to Show Items with No Data in Power BI (e.g. Show All Month Names)
value.excerpt: Sometimes the default behavior in Power BI can be frustrating. For example, if you are showing month names, you may see that if no data is available then those months may not be shown in your Chart or Table. Often, you would want all months (Jan-Dec) to be shown, regardless of whether data is present
